TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit EventSource extends System.Object implements class System.IDisposable

summary.span: 提供为 Windows 事件跟踪 (ETW) 创建事件的功能。

span.span: Provides the ability to create events for event tracing for Windows (ETW).

remarks.format: ## Remarks 此类应由提供要用于 ETW 的特定事件的用户类进行继承。This class is intended to be inherited by a user class that provides specific events to be used for ETW. 调用方法来记录事件。The methods are called to log the events. > [!IMPORTANT] > 此类型实现接口。This type implements the interface. 在使用完类型后，您应直接或间接释放类型。When you have finished using the type, you should dispose of it either directly or indirectly. 若要直接释放类型, 请`try` / `catch`在块中调用其方法。To dispose of the type directly, call its method in a `try`/`catch` block. 若要间接释放类型，请使用 `using`（在 C# 中）或 `Using`（在 Visual Basic 中）等语言构造。To dispose of it indirectly, use a language construct such as `using` (in C#) or `Using` (in Visual Basic). 有关详细信息, 请参阅接口主题中的 "使用实现 IDisposable 的对象" 一节。For more information, see the "Using an Object that Implements IDisposable" section in the interface topic. 的基本功能足以满足大多数应用程序的需求。The basic functionality of is sufficient for most applications. 如果要对创建的 ETW 清单进行更多的控制, 可将属性应用于方法。If you want more control over the ETW manifest that is created, you can apply the attribute to the methods. 对于高级事件源应用程序, 可以截获发送到派生事件源的命令并更改筛选, 或使 inheritor 执行操作 (如转储数据结构)。For advanced event source applications, it is possible to intercept the commands being sent to the derived event source and change the filtering, or to cause actions (such as dumping a data structure) to be performed by the inheritor. 事件源可以通过 Windows ETW 控制器 (如 Logman 工具) 立即激活。An event source can be activated with Windows ETW controllers, such as the Logman tool, immediately. 还可以通过编程方式控制和截获数据调度程序。It is also possible to programmatically control and intercept the data dispatcher. 类提供附加功能。The class provides additional functionality. 从开始 , 提供通道支持, 某些事件源验证规则已被宽松。 [!INCLUDE[net_v46](~/includes/net-v46-md.md)]Starting with [!INCLUDE[net_v46](~/includes/net-v46-md.md)], provides channel support and some of the event source validation rules have been relaxed. 这意味着：This means: - 类型现在可以实现接口。 types may now implement interfaces. 这样就可以在使用接口定义常见日志记录目标的高级日志记录系统中使用事件源类型。This enables the use of event source types in advanced logging systems that use interfaces to define a common logging target. - 引入了实用工具事件源类型的概念。The concept of a utility event source type has been introduced. 此功能可让你在项目中跨多个事件源类型共享代码, 以实现优化的重载等方案。This feature enables sharing code across multiple event source types in a project to enable scenarios such as optimized overloads. 对于提供面向[!INCLUDE[net_v451](~/includes/net-v451-md.md)]或更早版本的频道支持等功能的类版本, 请参阅[Microsoft EventSource Library 1.0.16](https://www.nuget.org/packages/Microsoft.Diagnostics.Tracing.EventSource)。For a version of the class that provides features such as channel support you are targeting [!INCLUDE[net_v451](~/includes/net-v451-md.md)] or earlier, see [Microsoft EventSource Library 1.0.16](https://www.nuget.org/packages/Microsoft.Diagnostics.Tracing.EventSource). ## Examples 下面的示例演示类的简单实现。The following example shows a simple implementation of the class. [!code-csharp[ETWTraceSmall#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR/etwtracesmall/cs/program.cs#1)] [!code-vb[ETWTraceSmall#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR/etwtracesmall/vb/program.vb#1)] 下面的示例演示了类的更复杂实现。The following example shows a more complex implementation of the class. [!code-csharp[ETWTrace#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR/etwtrace/cs/program.cs#1)] [!code-vb[ETWTrace#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR/etwtrace/vb/program.vb#1)]

summary.span: 释放 类的当前实例所使用的所有资源。

span.span: Releases all resources used by the current instance of the class.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 在完成使用 `Dispose` 后，应调用 。Call `Dispose` when you are finished using the . `Dispose` 方法使 处于不可用状态。The `Dispose` method leaves the in an unusable state. 调用`Dispose`后, 必须释放对的所有引用, 以便垃圾回收器能够回收占用的内存。After calling `Dispose`, you must release all references to the so the garbage collector can reclaim the memory that the was occupying. 有关详细信息, 请参阅[清理非托管资源](~/docs/standard/garbage-collection/unmanaged.md)和[实现 Dispose 方法](~/docs/standard/garbage-collection/implementing-dispose.md)。For more information, see [Cleaning Up Unmanaged Resources](~/docs/standard/garbage-collection/unmanaged.md) and [Implementing a Dispose Method](~/docs/standard/garbage-collection/implementing-dispose.md). > [!NOTE] > 每次释放对 `Dispose` 的最后一个引用前，均应调用 。Always call `Dispose` before you release your last reference to the . 否则，在垃圾回收器调用 对象的 `Finalize` 方法之前，该对象正在使用的资源不会被释放。Otherwise, the resources it is using will not be freed until the garbage collector calls the object's `Finalize` method.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 此方法由公共`Dispose()`方法`Finalize`和方法调用。This method is called by the public `Dispose()` method and the `Finalize` method. `Dispose()`调用受保护`Dispose(Boolean)`的方法, `disposing`并将参数`true`设置为。`Dispose()` invokes the protected `Dispose(Boolean)` method with the `disposing` parameter set to `true`. `Finalize`在`Dispose` 设置`disposing` 为`false`的情况调用。`Finalize` invokes `Dispose` with `disposing` set to `false`. 当 `disposing` 参数为 `true` 时，此方法释放该 引用的、由任何托管对象持有的全部资源。When the `disposing` parameter is `true`, this method releases all resources held by any managed objects that this references. 此方法调用每个引用对象的 `Dispose()` 方法。This method invokes the `Dispose()` method of each referenced object.

para.span: 可以由其他对象多次调用。

span.span: can be called multiple times by other objects.

para.span: 重写时, 请注意不要引用先前在 Dispose 方法调用中已释放的对象。

span.span: When overriding , be careful not to reference objects that have been previously disposed in an earlier the Dispose Method call to .

para.span: 有关如何实现的详细信息, 请参阅[实现 Dispose 方法](~/docs/standard/garbage-collection/implementing-dispose.md)。

span.span: For more information about how to implement , see [Implementing a Dispose Method](~/docs/standard/garbage-collection/implementing-dispose.md).

para.span: 有关 和的详细信息, 请参阅[清理非托管资源](~/docs/standard/garbage-collection/unmanaged.md)。

span.span: For more information about and , see [Cleaning Up Unmanaged Resources](~/docs/standard/garbage-collection/unmanaged.md).

remarks.format: ## Remarks `eventid`应大于0或小于 65535, 否则操作中可能会发生错误。`eventid` should be greater than 0 or less than 65535 or errors can occur in the operation. 如果发生错误, 则可以通过检查调试器的输出流来获取有关错误来源的详细信息, 前提是已将调试器附加到进程触发事件。If errors do occur, you can get more information about the source of the error by checking the output stream of the debugger, if you have a debugger attached to the process firing events. 如果在发生错误的事件源上有 ETW 侦听器, 还可以查看 ETW 事件流中报告的错误。You can also look for errors reported in the ETW event stream, if you have an ETW listener on the event source where the error occurs. 在派生类中实现标识为 ETW 事件的方法时。When you implement a method that is identified as an ETW event in an -derived class. 您必须调用基类方法 , 并将和与实现的方法相同的参数与下面的示例类似。You must call the base class method passing the and the same arguments as the implemented method similar to the following example. ```csharp [Event(2, Level = EventLevel.Informational)] public void Info1(string arg1) {  base.WriteEvent(2, arg1); } ``` ## Examples 下面的示例演示如何使用此方法重载来编写事件。The following example shows how to use this method overload to write an event. 此代码示例是为类提供的更大示例的一部分。This code example is part of a larger example provided for the class. remarks.format: ## Remarks 默认情况下, 如果调用的参数与其他方法重载之一不匹配, 编译器将调用此重载。By default, the compiler calls this overload if the parameters for the call do not match one of the other method overloads. 此重载的速度要慢于其他重载, 因为它执行以下操作:This overload is much slower than the other overloads, because it does the following: 1. 它分配一个数组来保存变量参数。It allocates an array to hold the variable argument. 2. 它将每个参数强制转换为对象 (这会导致基元类型的分配)。It casts each parameter to an object (which causes allocations for primitive types). 3. 它将这些对象分配到数组。It assigns these objects to the array. 4. 它调用函数, 该函数随后会确定每个参数的类型, 以便为 ETW 序列化该函数。It calls the function, which then determines the type of each argument so it can be serialized for ETW. 跟踪低容量事件时, 此重载的高开销不是很大, 因为只有在启用了提供程序时, 才会使用该方法。The high overhead for this overload is not significant when tracing low-volume events, because the method is used only when the provider is enabled. 但对于大容量事件, 性能开销可能很大。However, for high-volume events, the performance overhead can be significant. 通过使用方法创建一个新的、更快的重载, 可以避免使用大容量有效负载。You can avoid using for high-volume payloads by creating a new, faster overload with the method. `eventid`应大于0或小于 65535, 否则操作中可能会发生错误。`eventid` should be greater than 0 or less than 65535 or errors can occur in the operation. 如果发生错误, 则可以通过检查调试器的输出流来获取有关错误来源的详细信息, 前提是已将调试器附加到进程触发事件。If errors do occur, you can get more information about the source of the error by checking the output stream of the debugger, if you have a debugger attached to the process firing events. 如果在发生错误的事件源上有 ETW 侦听器, 还可以查看 ETW 事件流中报告的错误。You can also look for errors reported in the ETW event stream, if you have an ETW listener on the event source where the error occurs. 在派生类中实现标识为 ETW 事件的方法时。When you implement a method that is identified as an ETW event in an -derived class. 您必须调用基类方法 , 并将和与实现的方法相同的参数与下面的示例类似。You must call the base class method passing the and the same arguments as the implemented method similar to the following example. ```csharp [Event(2, Level = EventLevel.Informational)] public void Info1(string arg1) {  base.WriteEvent(2, arg1); } ```

remarks.format: ## Remarks 方法记录传输事件。The method logs a transfer event. 当前线程的活动记录事件, 这允许两个活动通过事件的使用者进行关联。The activity of the current thread is logged with the event, and this allows two activities to be related by a consumer of events. 调用此函数的 ETW 事件方法必须遵循以下准则:Your ETW event method calling this function must follow these guidelines: 1. 将第一个参数指定为名`relatedActivityId`为的。Specify the first parameter as a named `relatedActivityId`. 2. 将或指定为属性。Specify either or as the property. 3. 调用传入事件 id, 后跟相关 ID GUID, 后跟以相同顺序传递的事件方法的所有参数。Call passing in the event ID, followed by the related ID GUID, followed by all the parameters the event method is passed, in the same order. 如果`args`未使用, 则会将其转换为空数组, 以便对 ETW 进行调用。If `args` is not used, it is converted to an empty array for the resulting call to ETW. ## Examples 下面的代码示例演示如何指定调用的事件源。The following code example shows how you might can specify an event source that calls .
